_description: Glycolysis enzyme kinetic parameters for human red blood cells

_citations.general_model: Rapoport TA, Heinrich R, Jacobasch G, Rapoport S. A linear steady-state treatment of enzymatic chains. General properties, control and effector strength. Eur J Biochem. 1974;42(1):107-120
_citations.rbc_glycolysis: Rapoport TA, Heinrich R, Rapoport SM. The regulatory principles of glycolysis in erythrocytes in vivo and in vitro. A minimal comprehensive model describing steady states, quasi-steady states and time-dependent processes. Biochem J. 1976;154(2):449-469
_citations.detailed_kinetics: Joshi A, Palsson BO. Metabolic dynamics in the human red cell. Part I-A comprehensive kinetic model. J Theor Biol. 1989;141(4):515-528
_citations.mulquiney_model: Mulquiney PJ, Kuchel PW. Model of 2,3-bisphosphoglycerate metabolism in the human erythrocyte based on detailed enzyme kinetic equations: computer simulation and metabolic control analysis. Biochem J. 1999;342(Pt 3):567-580
_citations.enzyme_database: Schomburg I, Chang A, Ebeling C, et al. BRENDA, the enzyme database: updates and major new developments. Nucleic Acids Res. 2004;32(Database issue):D431-D433

hexokinase._notes: Rate-limiting step; product inhibition by G6P is critical for regulation

phosphofructokinase._notes: Key regulatory enzyme; sigmoidal kinetics for F6P; activated by ADP/AMP, inhibited by ATP

aldolase._notes: Keq very unfavorable (in mM units); driven forward by rapid consumption of products

triose_phosphate_isomerase._notes: Very fast equilibrating; near diffusion-limited enzyme

glyceraldehyde_3_phosphate_dehydrogenase._notes: Key regulatory point; NAD/NADH ratio important

phosphoglycerate_kinase._notes: First ATP-generating step; strongly favors ATP production

pyruvate_kinase._notes: Second ATP-generating step; essentially irreversible; cooperative for PEP

lactate_dehydrogenase._notes: Regenerates NAD+ for GAPDH; strongly favors lactate formation
